title.narrative: Provision of safe and comprehensive WASH, FSL, and Protection response in Marib

description.narrative: Overall Objective: The response aims for an efficient contribution to a sustainable improvement in the ability of Marib's governorate to address challenges of integration of Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs) and response to recurrent humanitarian needs setting a platform for long -term solutions. Specific Objective: i. Better protection for IDPs in temporary and permanent settlements, Protection needs of the most vulnerable IDPs and conflict affected people are identified and supported through durable solutions ii. Alleviation of humanitarian needs among IDPs and hosting communities, reduced public health risks, improved access to basic services, and access to immediate income generating opportunities through coordinated effort with local actors; A total of 1200 conflict -affected IDP House Holds (HHs) selected through a participatory process will receive YER 93,000 per HH per round, for six rounds modality to meet 80 % of their minimum food needs through Unconditional Cash Transfer (UCT)/ voucher modality depending on local markets functionality. The support will benefit a total of 8400 IDPs (2184 men, 1848 women, 2268 boys, 2100 girls). providing mitigation measures to protection risks in the targeted area, and providing beneficiaries with cash for protection assistance. Provide 8400 IDPs (2184 men, 1848 women, 2268 boys, 2100 girls) living in underserved areas in Marib district with safe, sufficient, and reliable drinking and domestic water supply services

participating-org.narrative: UN Office for the Co-ord of Hum Affairs

mailing-address.narrative: Oxfam House, John Smith Drive, Oxford, OX4 2JY

provider-org.narrative: UN Office for the Co-ord of Hum Affairs
